javadoc:
Represents a file in a {@link GFileSystem filesystem}.

Only valid while the {@link #getFilesystem() owning filesystem} object is still open and not {@link GFileSystem#close() closed}.

methods.javadoc:
The {@link GFileSystem} that owns this file.
@return {@link GFileSystem} that owns this file.
methods.name: getFilesystem
methods.comment: The GFileSystem that owns this file.

methods.javadoc:
The {@link FSRL} of this file.
@return {@link FSRL} of this file.
methods.name: getFSRL

methods.javadoc:
The parent directory of this file.
@return parent {@link GFile} directory of this file.
methods.name: getParentFile
methods.comment: The parent directory of this file.

return.comment: parent GFile directory of this file.

methods.javadoc:
The path and filename of this file, relative to its owning filesystem.
@return path and filename of this file, relative to its owning filesystem.
methods.name: getPath
methods.comment: The path and filename of this file, relative to its owning filesystem.

return.comment: path and filename of this file, relative to its owning filesystem.

methods.javadoc:
The name of this file.
@return name of this file.
methods.name: getName
isDirectory
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a directory.

return.comment: boolean true if this file is a directory, false otherwise.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the length of this file, or -1 if not known.
@return number of bytes in this file.
methods.name: getLength
methods.comment: Returns the length of this file, or -1 if not known.

return.comment: number of bytes in this file.

methods.name: getListing
methods.comment: Returns a listing of files in this sub-directory.

throws.comment: if not a directory or error when accessing files.

name: GFile
comment:
Represents a file in a GFileSystem.
 
 Only valid while the #getFilesystem() object is still open and not
 GFileSystem#close().
